SECRET.
BATTLE SITUATION - NOON - 15th SEPTEMBER, 1918.
1. WESTERN FRONT.
(a) British FRONT.
There is nothing to report.
(b) French Front.
The attack between the AISNE and AILETTE yesterday made an average advance of over a mile and captured the village of ALLEMANT and LAFFAUX MILL, 2,500 prisoners were taken.
In the ST. MIHIEL sector further progress has been made and the enemy has withdrawn his line on the left of the attack. The line reached now runs as follows :-
DIEPPE - south of ABAUCOURT - MORANVILLE - BLANZEE - MANHEULLES - RIAVILLE - ST. HILA1RE - DONCOURT - WOEL -ETANG DE LACHAUSSES - HAUMONT - North-east of JAULNY - VILLERS-SOUS-PRENY - NOEROY.
The captures are now officially stated to be 15,000 with 100 guns and large quantities of material.
The guns of METZ commenced firing yesterday afternoon.
2. ITALIAN AND MACEDONIAN FRONT.
Yesterday the Italians made a successful attack in the valley of the BRENTA and captured 375 prisoners including 15 officers.
General Staff,
War Office, S.W.1.
15th September, 1918.
Issued at 12.40 p.m.
